result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlene M. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs and DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Not to possess illegal substances without a valid prescription.
Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with Shopko Department Store in the Village of Plover.

Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy.
Sign releases of information so probation agent can supervise.
Participate with any other counseling as recommended by the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marlene M. Taylor in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:57 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Defendant will plead to the three counts as in the amended information.

Atty Constable states the agreement for the record.
Atty Mcfarland concurs
Defendant concurs.

Victim's rights were complied with and there is no restitution request.
(Atty Knaapen replaces Atty Constable)

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
(Atty Constable returns)
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1: NO CONTEST
Count 2: NO CONTEST
Count 3: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Mcfarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

Court takes a moment to review the criminal complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Possession of controlled substance
Count 2: Misdemeanor Retail Theft
Count 3: Misdemeanor Bailjumping

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court, states prior convictions.
Atty Mcfarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court intends to follow the plea agreement, believes it is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
30 Day Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 2 Years
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Perform 20 Hours of Community Service
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety
Not to possess illegal substances without a valid prescription
Not to posssess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy
Sign releases of information so probation agent can supervise
No contact with Shopko Department Store in the Village of Plover
Maintain full time employment or schooling or combination of both to equal full time
Participate with any other counseling as recommended by the agent

Count 2:
90 Day Jail Sentece, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1
Probation for a period of 2 Years, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 3:
30 Day Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed, independent of Count 1 and Count 2 (consecutive)
Probation for a period of 1 Year, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

There is 0 days of jail credit.
Defendant Record Update
Plea hearing on March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marlene M. Taylor in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:12 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.

Case to be Pre-Tried today.
Arraignment on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
for Attorney to Appear and Act

Atty McFarland

Defendant Marlene M. Taylor in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
